string-array.name: data_name_array
string-array.item: Universitas Islam Negeri Sunan Kalijaga Yogyakarta

string-array.name: data_description_array
string-array.item: Established in 1949, the Universitas Gadjah Mada (Gadjah Mada University) is a non-profit public higher education institution located in the suburban setting of the metropolis of Sleman (population range of 1,000,000-5,000,000 inhabitants), Yogyakarta SR. This institution also has a branch campus in Jakarta. Officially recognized by the Kementerian Pendidikan, Kebudayaan, Riset, dan Teknologi, Republik Indonesia (Ministry of Education, Culture, Research and Technology, Republic of Indonesia), Universitas Gadjah Mada (UGM) is a very large-sized (uniRank enrollment range: 35,000-39,999 students) coeducational Indonesian higher education institution. Universitas Gadjah Mada (UGM) offers courses and programs leading to officially recognized higher education degrees such as bachelor's degrees in several areas of study. See the uniRank degree levels and areas of study table below for further details. This 74-year-old Indonesian higher-education institution has a selective admission policy based on entrance examinations. The acceptance rate range is 0-9% making this Indonesian higher education organization an extremely selective institution. International applicants are eligible to apply for enrollment. UGM also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students including a library, housing, sports facilities, financial aids and/or scholarships, study abroad and exchange programs, as well as administrative services.

Established in 1964, the Universitas Negeri Yogyakarta (State University of Yogyakarta) is a non-profit public higher education institution located in the metropolis of Sleman (population range of 1,000,000-5,000,000 inhabitants), Yogyakarta SR. Officially recognized by the Kementerian Pendidikan, Kebudayaan, Riset, dan Teknologi, Republik Indonesia (Ministry of Education, Culture, Research and Technology, Republic of Indonesia), Universitas Negeri Yogyakarta (UNY) is a large-sized (uniRank enrollment range: 20,000-24,999 students) coeducational Indonesian higher education institution. Universitas Negeri Yogyakarta (UNY) offers courses and programs leading to officially recognized higher education degrees such as bachelor's degrees in several areas of study. See the uniRank degree levels and areas of study table below for further details. This 60-year-old Indonesian higher-education institution has a selective admission policy based on entrance examinations. UNY also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students including a library, sports facilities, as well as administrative services.

Founded in 1945, the Universitas Islam Indonesia (Islamic University of Indonesia) is a non-profit private higher education institution located in the urban setting of the metropolis of Sleman (population range of 1,000,000-5,000,000 inhabitants), Yogyakarta SR. Officially recognized by the Kementerian Pendidikan, Kebudayaan, Riset, dan Teknologi, Republik Indonesia (Ministry of Education, Culture, Research and Technology, Republic of Indonesia), Universitas Islam Indonesia (UII) is a large-sized (uniRank enrollment range: 20,000-24,999 students) coeducational Indonesian higher education institution formally affiliated with the Islamic religion. Universitas Islam Indonesia (UII) offers courses and programs leading to officially recognized higher education degrees such as bachelor's degrees, master's degrees and doctorate degrees in several areas of study. See the uniRank degree levels and areas of study table below for further details. This 79-year-old Indonesian higher-education institution has a selective admission policy based on entrance examinations. The acceptance rate range is 10-19% making this Indonesian higher education organization an extremely selective institution. International students are welcome to apply for enrollment. UII also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students including a library, sports facilities, study abroad and exchange programs, online courses and distance learning opportunities, as well as administrative services.

Founded in 1981, the Universitas Muhammadiyah Yogyakarta (Muhammadiyah University of Yogyakarta) is a non-profit private higher education institution located in the suburban setting of the metropolis of Bantul (population range of 1,000,000-5,000,000 inhabitants), Yogyakarta SR. Officially recognized by the Kementerian Pendidikan, Kebudayaan, Riset, dan Teknologi, Republik Indonesia (Ministry of Education, Culture, Research and Technology, Republic of Indonesia), Universitas Muhammadiyah Yogyakarta (UMY) is a large-sized (uniRank enrollment range: 20,000-24,999 students) coeducational Indonesian higher education institution formally affiliated with the Islamic religion. Universitas Muhammadiyah Yogyakarta (UMY) offers courses and programs leading to officially recognized higher education degrees such as bachelor's degrees and master's degrees in several areas of study. See the uniRank degree levels and areas of study table below for further details. This 43-year-old Indonesian higher-education institution has a selective admission policy based on entrance examinations and students' past academic records and grades. The acceptance rate range is 30-39% making this Indonesian higher education organization a very selective institution. International students are welcome to apply for enrollment. UMY also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students including a library, housing, sports facilities, financial aids and/or scholarships, study abroad and exchange programs, online courses and distance learning opportunities, as well as administrative services.

Founded in 2004, the Universitas Islam Negeri Sunan Kalijaga Yogyakarta (State Islamic University of Yogyakarta) is a non-profit public higher education institution located in the metropolis of Sleman (population range of 1,000,000-5,000,000 inhabitants), Yogyakarta SR. Officially recognized by the Kementerian Pendidikan, Kebudayaan, Riset, dan Teknologi, Republik Indonesia (Ministry of Education, Culture, Research and Technology, Republic of Indonesia), Universitas Islam Negeri Sunan Kalijaga Yogyakarta (UIN Sunan Kalijaga) is a large-sized (uniRank enrollment range: 15,000-19,999 students) coeducational Indonesian higher education institution formally affiliated with the Islamic religion. Universitas Islam Negeri Sunan Kalijaga Yogyakarta (UIN Sunan Kalijaga) offers courses and programs leading to officially recognized higher education degrees such as bachelor's degrees, master's degrees and doctorate degrees in several areas of study. See the uniRank degree levels and areas of study table below for further details. This 20-year-old Indonesian higher-education institution has a selective admission policy based on entrance examinations. UIN Sunan Kalijaga also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students including a library, sports facilities, financial aids and/or scholarships, as well as administrative services.

Established in 1965, the Universitas Atma Jaya Yogyakarta (Atma Jaya University, Yogyakarta) is a non-profit private higher education institution located in the urban setting of the metropolis of Sleman (population range of 1,000,000-5,000,000 inhabitants), Yogyakarta SR. Officially recognized by the Kementerian Pendidikan, Kebudayaan, Riset, dan Teknologi, Republik Indonesia (Ministry of Education, Culture, Research and Technology, Republic of Indonesia), Universitas Atma Jaya Yogyakarta (UAJY) is a large-sized (uniRank enrollment range: 10,000-14,999 students) coeducational Indonesian higher education institution formally affiliated with the Christian-Catholic religion. Universitas Atma Jaya Yogyakarta (UAJY) offers courses and programs leading to officially recognized higher education degrees such as bachelor's degrees, master's degrees and doctorate degrees in several areas of study. See the uniRank degree levels and areas of study table below for further details. This 58-year-old Indonesian higher-education institution has a selective admission policy based on entrance examinations. The acceptance rate range is 40-49% making this Indonesian higher education organization an averagely selective institution. International applicants are eligible to apply for enrollment. UAJY also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students including a library, housing, sports facilities, financial aids and/or scholarships, study abroad and exchange programs, as well as administrative services.

Established in 1994, the Universitas Ahmad Dahlan (Ahmad Dahlan University) is a non-profit private higher education institution located in the urban setting of the metropolis of Yogyakarta (population range of 1,000,000-5,000,000 inhabitants), Yogyakarta SR. This institution also has a branch campus in Bantul and Kulon Progo. Officially recognized by the Kementerian Pendidikan, Kebudayaan, Riset, dan Teknologi, Republik Indonesia (Ministry of Education, Culture, Research and Technology, Republic of Indonesia), Universitas Ahmad Dahlan (UAD) is a large-sized (uniRank enrollment range: 25,000-29,999 students) coeducational Indonesian higher education institution formally affiliated with the Islamic religion. Universitas Ahmad Dahlan (UAD) offers courses and programs leading to officially recognized higher education degrees such as bachelor's degrees, master's degrees and doctorate degrees in several areas of study. See the uniRank degree levels and areas of study table below for further details. This 29-year-old Indonesian higher-education institution has a selective admission policy based on entrance examinations and students' past academic records and grades. The acceptance rate range is 80-89% making this Indonesian higher education organization a least selective institution. International applicants are eligible to apply for enrollment. UAD also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students including a library, housing, sports facilities, financial aids and/or scholarships, study abroad and exchange programs, online courses and distance learning opportunities, as well as administrative services.

Founded in 2014, the Universitas Pembangunan Nasional Veteran Yogyakarta (University of Pembangunan Nasional Veteran, Yogyakarta) is a non-profit public higher education institution located in the urban setting of the metropolis of Sleman (population range of 1,000,000-5,000,000 inhabitants), Yogyakarta SR. Officially recognized by the Kementerian Pendidikan, Kebudayaan, Riset, dan Teknologi, Republik Indonesia (Ministry of Education, Culture, Research and Technology, Republic of Indonesia), Universitas Pembangunan Nasional Veteran Yogyakarta (UPNYK) is a medium-sized (uniRank enrollment range: 9,000-9,999 students) coeducational Indonesian higher education institution. Universitas Pembangunan Nasional Veteran Yogyakarta (UPNYK) offers courses and programs leading to officially recognized higher education degrees such as bachelor's degrees and master's degrees in several areas of study. See the uniRank degree levels and areas of study table below for further details. This 9-year-old Indonesian higher-education institution has a selective admission policy based on entrance examinations. International students are welcome to apply for enrollment. UPNYK also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students including a library, housing, sports facilities, financial aids and/or scholarships, as well as administrative services.

Founded in 1955, the Universitas Sanata Dharma (Sanata Dharma University) is a non-profit private higher education institution located in the suburban setting of the metropolis of Sleman (population range of 1,000,000-5,000,000 inhabitants), Yogyakarta SR. Officially recognized by the Kementerian Pendidikan, Kebudayaan, Riset, dan Teknologi, Republik Indonesia (Ministry of Education, Culture, Research and Technology, Republic of Indonesia), Universitas Sanata Dharma (USD) is a small-sized (uniRank enrollment range: 4,000-4,999 students) coeducational Indonesian higher education institution formally affiliated with the Christian-Catholic religion. Universitas Sanata Dharma (USD) offers courses and programs leading to officially recognized higher education degrees such as pre-bachelor's degrees (i.e. certificates, diplomas, associate or foundation), bachelor's degrees and master's degrees in several areas of study. See the uniRank degree levels and areas of study table below for further details. This 68-year-old Indonesian higher-education institution has a selective admission policy based on entrance examinations and students' past academic records and grades. The acceptance rate range is 20-29% making this Indonesian higher education organization a very selective institution. International students are welcome to apply for enrollment. USD also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students including a library, housing, sports facilities, financial aids and/or scholarships, study abroad and exchange programs, as well as administrative services.

Founded in 2006, the Universitas Alma Ata (Alma Ata University) is a private higher education institution located in the metropolis of Yogyakarta (population range of 1,000,000-5,000,000 inhabitants), Yogyakarta SR. Officially recognized by the Kementerian Pendidikan, Kebudayaan, Riset, dan Teknologi, Republik Indonesia (Ministry of Education, Culture, Research and Technology, Republic of Indonesia), Universitas Alma Ata (UAA) is a very small-sized (uniRank enrollment range: under-250 students) coeducational Indonesian higher education institution formally affiliated with the Islamic religion. Universitas Alma Ata (UAA) offers courses and programs leading to officially recognized higher education degrees such as pre-bachelor's degrees (i.e. certificates, diplomas, associate or foundation) and bachelor's degrees in several areas of study. See the uniRank degree levels and areas of study table below for further details. This 18-year-old Indonesian higher-education institution has a selective admission policy based on entrance examinations. International students are welcome to apply for enrollment. UAA also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students including a library, housing, financial aids and/or scholarships, study abroad and exchange programs, as well as administrative services.

Established in 1985, the Universitas Kristen Duta Wacana (Duta Wacana Christian University) is a non-profit private higher education institution located in the urban setting of the metropolis of Yogyakarta (population range of 1,000,000-5,000,000 inhabitants), Yogyakarta SR. Officially recognized by the Kementerian Pendidikan, Kebudayaan, Riset, dan Teknologi, Republik Indonesia (Ministry of Education, Culture, Research and Technology, Republic of Indonesia), Universitas Kristen Duta Wacana (UKDW Yogyakarta) is a very small-sized (uniRank enrollment range: 500-999 students) coeducational Indonesian higher education institution formally affiliated with the Christian-Protestant religion. Universitas Kristen Duta Wacana (UKDW Yogyakarta) offers courses and programs leading to officially recognized higher education degrees such as bachelor's degrees, master's degrees and doctorate degrees in several areas of study. This 39-year-old Indonesian higher-education institution has a selective admission policy based on students' past academic records and grades. The acceptance rate range is 70-79% making this Indonesian higher education organization a moderately selective institution. International applicants are eligible to apply for enrollment. UKDW Yogyakarta also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students including a library, housing, sports facilities, financial aids and/or scholarships, study abroad and exchange programs, online courses and distance learning opportunities, as well as administrative services.

Established in 1955, the Universitas Sarjanawiyata Tamansiswa (Sarjanawiyata Tamansiswa University) is a for-profit private higher education institution located in the metropolis of Yogyakarta (population range of 1,000,000-5,000,000 inhabitants), Yogyakarta SR. Officially recognized by the Kementerian Pendidikan, Kebudayaan, Riset, dan Teknologi, Republik Indonesia (Ministry of Education, Culture, Research and Technology, Republic of Indonesia), Universitas Sarjanawiyata Tamansiswa (UST) is a large-sized (uniRank enrollment range: 10,000-14,999 students) coeducational Indonesian higher education institution. This 68-year-old Indonesian higher-education institution has a selective admission policy based on entrance examinations. International applicants are eligible to apply for enrollment. UST also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students including a library, housing, sports facilities, financial aids and/or scholarships, study abroad and exchange programs, online courses and distance learning opportunities, as well as administrative services.

Founded in 1984, the Institut Seni Indonesia Yogyakarta (Indonesian Institute of the Arts, Yogyakarta) is a non-profit public higher education institution located in the suburban setting of the metropolis of Yogyakarta (population range of 1,000,000-5,000,000 inhabitants), Yogyakarta SR. Officially recognized by the Kementerian Pendidikan, Kebudayaan, Riset, dan Teknologi, Republik Indonesia (Ministry of Education, Culture, Research and Technology, Republic of Indonesia), Institut Seni Indonesia Yogyakarta (ISI Yogyakarta) is a coeducational Indonesian higher education institution. This 40-year-old Indonesian higher-education institution has a selective admission policy based on entrance examinations. ISI Yogyakarta also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students including a library, as well as administrative services.

Founded in 2008, the Universitas Mercu Buana Yogyakarta (Mercu Buana University of Yogyakarta) is a private higher education institution located in the metropolis of Yogyakarta (population range of 1,000,000-5,000,000 inhabitants), Yogyakarta SR. Officially recognized by the Kementerian Pendidikan, Kebudayaan, Riset, dan Teknologi, Republik Indonesia (Ministry of Education, Culture, Research and Technology, Republic of Indonesia), Universitas AMIKOM Yogyakarta is a coeducational Indonesian higher education institution.
